intro: Gossypianthus decipiens, commonly known as the false cotton plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gossypianthus decipiens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
